title: Atmeshwar Temple
review: nice temple and nice holistic place. Without puskar 4 dham yatra not completed. We must have be watch this.

title: A temple devoted to Brahma, with a fantastic outlook.
review: This temple is somewhat hidden away.  It is worth the visit, as it is apparently the only one devoted to Brahma the senior of the Hindu Gods.  But it is very crowded, as most Hindus travel there in their lifetime.  You have to line up and wait for up to an hour to get to the door in the busy perods.

title: Nice temple
review: During Pushkar trip visited this temple. It was good temple. Crowded with local people. Took blessing from god. Peacefully atmosphere.

title: Not better or worse
review: Nothing special. Not better and mostly not worse than other temples in Pushkar. But its  bad location is bad for its fame. Although it stands very close to the main market road. As soon as you pass the mosque, you should turn not to the left, where you lead the way to Brahma temple, but to the right and after about 60 meters turn left. Or the second option – to find the "Diamond hotel" (I stayed there), go straight along this street without turning anywhere. There will still be something like a small garden. Keep in mind – this temple is often confused with the more famous Apteshwar temple – apparently because of the similar name.

title: Very good temple
review: This is a very good temple to visit as it gives peace of mind, even though this temple is always crowded.

title: Fantastic example
review: We visited the Atmeshwar Temple in the early morning after walking to it through the market which was beginning to open. As you have to enter this location in bare feet, you can buy socks from the small cafe at the foot of the steps. You are not allowed to enter this Temple with phones or cameras. Even in the early morning the Temple was busy, but we were made very welcome and the was a lot to see, but you do not need more than an hour, before you head down to the Lake.

title: Shiva..
review: Pushkar is a holy city and special place in Hindu mytholodgy hence you will find so many temples here. This one is an old Shiva temple with shivaling...

title: Nice temple to visit
review: It is amazing temple to visit. You will literally feel inner peace in your body. Very calm and peaceful place for meditation.

title: quite, not so crowded
review: I enjoyed the visit of this temple more than the more popular Brahma one, as this was not so crowded. I was in town during the camel festival, so finding quite places wasn't that easy.

title: BE AWARE!!!
review: BE AWARE!!!

title: lord shiva is great and astonised  idole and symble
review: We visited through gorma tours arranged a metaphysically  tours  pushkar and we satisfied from gorma tours service for local handling travel agent  and provide a travel services -hotel booking and transport and camel safari in pushkar and we more enjoy there very friendly and knowledgeable unforgetable tours pushkar

title: Nice for a Short Visit
review: It is a nice place for a short visit and is a really vibrant temple. Usually a great deal of hustle and bustle around the temple and a great place to soak up the energy!

title: Ok
review: Nice temple to see, but when you've been around in India their are so many amazing other ones which is why i gave it 3 star..

title: Temple has changed over the years
review: It is difficult to get near the shrine and always seems to be busy. They have put fences around since i first went there, and place need to be cleaned properly. It seems to be neglected. We need to maintain the charm of Pushkar, still my favorite places for a short visit.

title: Mesmerizing
review: Temple's are a great place to seek mental peace. And Atmeshwar temple is just the right place to  find it for me. A memorable experience.

title: Good for quick detour!
review: The Atmeshwar temple is a regular temple. Usually crowded and can be given a miss if one is hard on time.

title: Busy and crowded with local people.
review: Not much of an attraction other than a small temple where worshippers go to worship. No photpgraphy is allowed and cameras and mobiles have to be deposited at the entrance. when its so crowded , one would feel claustrophobic. Nothing really missed if we give this Mandir a miss.

title: Sikh Temple
review: Very nice small temple. You need to leave your shoes out, your head should be covered, you need to wash your hands and feed.

title: Nice one
review: This temple of lord shiva is confused with Aptaeshwar temple.We asked for Aptaeshwar temple and all of them guided us with this temple.However, after walking through the local market we finally arrived here.Nothing much to see here. Only you have to climb down to see the shive lingam and worship there, just like any shiva temple in your locality.

title: Atmeshwar Temple
review: During the months of October – November. This is time when the famous Pushkar Camel Fair comes to town, and also the weather is nicer during these months.

title: Atmeshwar Temple
review: This temple was on the way to brahma temple. After entrance we 1st thought this is a south indian type temple. But sooner we got its not just like that. Temple was surrounded with smooth sand.

title: "great place"
review: i visited there with my family its was a great day .the temple was really good. me and my family prayed for each other health and success. thnkns atmeshwar temple

title: Beautiful Shiva temple in Pushkar
review: After bathing in the Pushkar lake and Lord Brahma Dharshan we went in search of hot tea and chanced upon this beautiful Shiva temple. It is a nice temple and quiet with no crowd at all, We felt blessed having dharshan of Lord Shiva also in the famed city of Pushkar well known for the unique Brahma temple in the wold. Must visit to complete the Pushkar tourism. It is just 5 minutes walk from Brahma temple along the small shops in tourist marker area.

title: Jaipur trip
review: It is a very famous temple and a must go. What i dont like is that they have started treating temples like this and business hubs and people make lakhs of rupees selling stuff under pretext of prasad
